channel.title: Comments for page "Ash-Covered Tile"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Ash-Covered Tile"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Yeah. You would need to seriously enjoy crunching numbers to get any drop rates on here. I mean look at kingdom of loathing. There are a ton of people on there whose whole goal is simply to figure out the mechanics and drop rates of the game. Every time something new comes out, several people spend several thousand turns there just to find the average drop rate of stuff.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I'd like to agree with you but two years since someone tried and we have two posts, I think it's fair to say nobody cares that much anymore. It's not like it will make any difference, you just appraise until you get enough, and if you get spares, it's probably a tiny fraction of what you spent overall, unless you appraised foolish amounts to finish with. It's not worth the time it would take to refine the figures any further…

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Ah so you did. It's been a long night of half-work. But either way more data and it's great.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Me "The data is not heavily researched"
RikaCovena: *deletes that* "The percentages were changed around"
You: 'Give me more data'
Me: WTF I just said that

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Not quite the same thing prince. At least these percentages are more believable than a steel tile dropping 55% of the time. I could technically accept it, I just don't like unproven percentages. Give me a pool of at least 1000 appraisals (or even more than that) and a link to it, and I am more prone to believe the research. Not just "this is what we think it is supposed to be around."

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Not really a necessary change there RikaCovena since it just says the same thing…

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I don't even know. It might have been that nobody just bothered to pay attention to statistics without reference. I mean it looks like they had some fairly correct statistics, but they were in the wrong lineup.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: How did nobody notice that earlier… I hope nobody actually believed that lol. Well it's sorted now.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I think someone needs to get rid of those inappropriate tile estimates that were edited in. They are way off considering wooden is supposed to be more common than steel and ceramic.

item.title: Tile appraisals
item.content:encoded:
In order to start getting accurate estimates of tile distribution, here is information I've collected on Ash Covered Tiles. If enough people add to this, we can get a pretty accurate idea of the distribution.

150 Tiles

108 - Wooden ~ 72%
37 - Ceramic ~ 25%
5 -Steel ~ 3%
